poem:
**Review Under the Ivy**  

Under old oaks, whispers weave—  
a campus breathes in autumn air.  
Yet political winds rise,  
scrutinize books and banners,  
measure discourse by grants,  
while ivy clings to brick facades,  
holding more than history—  
a silent witness  
to the temporary dance  
of scrutiny and conjecture.
